channel.title: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet
channel.description: Anyone have any suggestions/ feel like making a one page template for this: http://silabsoft.org/doge/index.php I am using ajax to pull the data from my small php class so I would not need anything more than a single page.

item.title: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:4, topic:537761”]Wouldn’t that create a lot of overhead for a simple page?[/quote]Caching, yo, caching.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet

item.title: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:6, topic:537761”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=656586.msg4393416#msg4393416 date=1388353682]

DOGEFAUCET

much rep, wow so style

Thought about using a framework? Something like Foundation, Bootstrap or Skeleton would do.

Wouldn’t that create a lot of overhead for a simple page?

Not particularly, it also leaves room for expansion if it’s ever needed. Something like Foundation isn’t a strain on resources, isn’t flashy and is just as it says on the tin. It has all the bells and whistles at minimal input from anything other factor. For something like this I’d say go for it with a framework. You never know what you might want to add at a later date. If it comes to it you could trim the excess code and just pick from it what you need, I suppose.
[/quote]

I disagree with the use of Foundation (or any other framework) in this context, it’s less than likely the OP would ever need any of the components it offers; a simple HTML5 boilerplate would suffice. I would however suggest the use of a small library like Backbone to add some structure and perhaps even make use of a RESTful API (assuming one is being used). See Backbone.js[/quote]

thanks for the resource.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet

item.title: Looking for a clean template for onepage dogecoin faucet
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:5, topic:537761”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=656586.msg4393398#msg4393398 date=1388346314]

DOGEFAUCET

much rep, wow so style

Thought about using a framework? Something like Foundation, Bootstrap or Skeleton would do.

Wouldn’t that create a lot of overhead for a simple page?
[/quote]

Not particularly, it also leaves room for expansion if it’s ever needed. Something like Foundation isn’t a strain on resources, isn’t flashy and is just as it says on the tin. It has all the bells and whistles at minimal input from anything other factor. For something like this I’d say go for it with a framework. You never know what you might want to add at a later date. If it comes to it you could trim the excess code and just pick from it what you need, I suppose.[/quote]

I disagree with the use of Foundation (or any other framework) in this context, it’s less than likely the OP would ever need any of the components it offers; a simple HTML5 boilerplate would suffice. I would however suggest the use of a small library like Backbone to add some structure and perhaps even make use of a RESTful API (assuming one is being used). See Backbone.js
